title: Why are singers like Selena Gomez and Britney Spears famous when they can hardly sing? - Quora

response.answer_text: I can’t speak for Selena Gomez, as I’ve never worked with her, but Britney can actually sing. I’m not saying she’s Aretha Franklin but to say she can hardly sing is just false. I first heard Britney singing Whitney Houston’s ‘I Have Nothing’ on a demo she did when she was 11. She was belting out high notes with feeling and control. I worked with her in the studio many times and she was quite a capable singer. I can understand if a pop singing isn’t your thing but she has good pitch, phrasing, and overall musicality. Again, she’s not the most amazing singer I’ve heard, but she can certainly hold a tune and deliver a performance. If she was a contestant on American Idol you’d be saying, wow, now that girl has a chance to win the whole thing.

I believe they can hold a tune and have an overall mass appeal. Also, pop music genre is not about singing. You think Ella Fitzgerald can sing Toxic the way Britney Spears does? Maybe she could, but Britney certainly can because that’s where she shines. She is an amazing performer with an eye for eccentric fashion and a body built for dance, albeit all in 00s and late 90s. As for Selena Gomez, her talent is questionable for sure but millenials can relate to her because she is a part of their childhood (Wizards of Waverly Place). It is like asking why people don’t have kale smoothies at McDonald’s instead of Coke. They are healthier and don’t contain insane amounts of sugar. Because people like it, it is a simple drink and sometimes that’s all what people need. It doesn’t mean a kale smoothie is not getting its due.
